title: How India's punitive measures will continue to hit Pak's fragile economy - Explained
content: Despite the India-Pakistan ceasefire, India's economic measures against Pakistan remain in effect. These actions, initiated after the Pahalgam attack, include the suspension of the Indus Waters Treaty, impacting Pakistan's water resources and agriculture. A complete ban on direct and indirect trade further cripples Pakistan's economy by blocking $500 million in goods.

title: 'US has chickened out': How Xi called Trump's bluff on trade war
content: In a surprising turn, the US and China have agreed to de-escalate their trade war, with the US significantly reducing tariffs on Chinese goods. Beijing responded by lowering its tariffs on US products. This truce, reached in Geneva, has stunned markets and analysts, as it appears China secured its objectives without major economic reforms.

title: Microsoft's second biggest layoffs: These are employees to be impacted
content: Microsoft will reduce its workforce by 3%. This affects about 7,000 employees globally. The company aims to streamline operations. Microsoft seeks a flatter structure. It prioritizes engineering talent for AI. New performance management includes a rehire ban. Microsoft follows an industry trend. Other tech firms also focus on efficiency. These changes follow better-than-expected quarterly results.

title: 'Force of Indian arms ... ': MEA reiterates trade not discussed in US talks
content: India's Ministry of External Affairs refuted Donald Trump's claim that trade was used as leverage to broker a ceasefire with Pakistan during Operation Sindoor. The MEA emphasized that the ceasefire was a result of Pakistan's request after Indian strikes on its air bases.

title: US-China trade: Trump says he called Apple CEO after China tariff rollback and ...
content: Following a US-China trade agreement where tariffs are suspended for 90 days, President Trump claimed Apple CEO Tim Cook plans to increase US investments, potentially building more plants. This news follows reports of Apple considering iPhone price hikes, possibly linked to tariffs.

title: Mark Carney in Spotlight as Canada Loses 1.6 Million Jobs, 30,000 Cut in April
content: Canada's economy faces headwinds as April 2025 saw a meager 7,400 jobs added, pushing unemployment to 6.9%. U.S. tariffs on key exports like steel and automobiles are significantly impacting the manufacturing sector, leading to job losses. While the public sector offered slight relief, broader economic concerns persist, pressuring the Bank of Canada to consider interest rate cuts.

title: Trump cuts $450 million more from Harvard's funding after $2.2 billion freeze
content: The Trump administration has intensified its conflict with Harvard University, slashing an additional $450 million in federal grants, adding to the previously frozen $2.2 billion. The White House accuses Harvard of fostering discrimination and neglecting accountability. Harvard is contesting the funding freeze, alleging government overreach into academic affairs.

title: NBA injury: How long Jayson Tatum of Boston Celtics rumored to be out
content: Jayson Tatum's Achilles injury during Game 4 against the Knicks has sidelined him for the remainder of the postseason, a major blow to the Celtics who are trailing 3-1. The injury could keep Tatum out until mid-March of next season, potentially impacting the 2025-26 season.

title: Operation Keller: 3 local Lashkar terrorists killed in south Kashmir
content: In a counterterrorism operation in Shopian, three Lashkar-e-Taiba terrorists were killed by security forces. Two of the slain men were identified as Shahid Kuttay and Adnan Shafi Dar, both locals linked to the April 22 Pahalgam attack. The operation followed intelligence inputs and a fierce firefight in the Shoekal Keller area, marking the second security shootout in Kashmir this year.

title: Op Sindoor: MP min sparks row for 'sister from terrorists' community' remark
content: Vijay Shah, a Madhya Pradesh minister, made controversial remarks about Colonel Sofia Qureshi. His comments drew criticism from opposition leaders. Congress president Mallikarjun Kharge condemned Shah's statements. He called them insulting and demanded the minister's dismissal. Shah later clarified his remarks. He stated that they should not be construed in a different context. The controversy continues to escalate.

title: How US-China trade deal will likely impact India - Explained
content: The US-China trade agreement, temporarily reducing tariffs, poses challenges for India's trade negotiations with the US. Securing a favorable bilateral trade agreement with the US and leveraging domestic strengths are crucial for India to remain competitive in the global supply chain.

title: ‘We need to leave...’: Alyssa Healy recollects Dharamsala experience
content: Australian cricketer Alyssa Healy recounted a harrowing experience during the IPL 2025 in Dharamsala. A security threat, involving a reported airspace breach, triggered an emergency evacuation. Players and families were rushed to safety amidst confusion and fear, with stadium lights blacked out. The IPL was temporarily suspended but has since resumed with a revised schedule and heightened security measures.

title: Op Sindoor: 'My eyes welled up when it worked so well,' says the man behind Akash
content: The indigenous Akash missile defence system, developed over 15 years by Indian scientists, successfully countered Pakistani drone and missile attacks along the western border. Prahlada Ramarao, the project director, expressed immense pride in the system's performance, highlighting its cost-effectiveness. Inspired by Dr. APJ Abdul Kalam, the project overcame challenges in developing the Rajendra radar.

title: Trent Grisham gets emotional while talking about Oswaldo Cabrera
content: Despite a triumphant 5-11 victory against the Seattle Mariners, the New York Yankees faced concern as Oswaldo Cabrera was injured, requiring an ambulance. Trent Grisham expressed deep emotion, emphasizing Cabrera's exceptional character and dedication. Even while injured, Cabrera's focus remained on the game, inquiring about the score, showcasing his unwavering team spirit.

title: Chinese defence stocks drop up to 9% after rising during Op Sindoor
content: Chinese defence stocks plummeted following a ceasefire between India and Pakistan, erasing earlier gains fueled by expectations of increased arms sales to Pakistan. The Hang Seng China A Aerospace & Defence Index saw a significant drop, with companies like AVIC Chengdu Aircraft and Zhuzhou Hongda experiencing substantial losses.

title: 'TRF a front of LeT; will push for it to be listed as terror entity at UNSC': MEA
content: India is set to push for the United Nations to designate The Resistance Front (TRF), an offshoot of Lashkar-e-Taiba, as a terrorist organization following several attacks in Jammu and Kashmir. The Ministry of External Affairs (MEA) announced plans to send a team to the UNSC's 1267 Sanctions Committee meeting this week to pursue sanctions and travel bans on TRF members.

title: Random Musings: If K-Pop fans don't get ya, Beer Biceps must
content: There are millions of fights going on at the same time. There’s Kohli vs Rohit, BTS vs Blackpink, Messi vs Ronaldo, Ranbir vs Ranveer fans, Salman vs SRK, ChatGPT vs Gemini, Trads vs Raytas, BJP vs Congress IT Cells – but all internecine fights were put to rest amid the siren call of war and Indians became unhinged dogs of war against anyone trying to push Pakistan’s narrative: Pakistanis with VPNs who were on Twitter, YouTube channels pushing the Pakistani agenda, or even mainstream publications pushing Pakistan’s narrative without any fact checks.

title: Raj Babbar speaks about his last moments with Smita Patil: She looked at me with tears in her eyes
content: Smita Patil's life was marked by her powerful performances and controversial relationship with Raj Babbar. Their love story began amidst Raj's existing marriage to Nadira, causing public backlash and emotional turmoil. Despite the challenges and societal judgment, Smita remained committed to her love, facing both joy and pain until her untimely death shortly after giving birth to their son, Prateik.

title: Indian Army briefs 70 nations on successful conduct of Operation Sindoor
content: Lt Gen D S Rana briefed defence attaches from 70 nations on Operation Sindoor's success, highlighting its impact on India-Pakistan relations. He emphasized India's military superiority and precise targeting of terror-linked sites. The briefing also addressed misinformation campaigns and showcased the integrated approach and technological advancements used in the operation.

title: 'Awami League ban in Bangladesh without due process is concerning': India
content: India has voiced strong concerns over the recent political turmoil in Bangladesh, triggered by the banning of the Awami League under a revised anti-terrorism law. This action, along with the revocation of the party's registration, raises worries about shrinking democratic space. India urges Bangladesh to hold free and fair elections, emphasizing the importance of democratic freedoms.

title: Angry paps confront Virat Kohli at Mumbai airport
content: Following Virat Kohli's Test retirement announcement, paparazzi at the Mumbai airport expressed their disappointment, stating they would no longer watch cricket. Kohli, accompanied by Anushka Sharma, politely declined photos due to time constraints.

title: ‘Don’t politically penalise Modi govt for exploring peace’: Mufti
content: PDP chief Mehbooba Mufti urged opposition parties to support the Modi government's peace initiatives, particularly the recent ceasefire. She emphasized the need for bipartisan statesmanship and a national consensus, drawing parallels to past leaders who engaged across borders during tense times. Mufti also criticized media narratives for distracting from real issues and fueling division.

title: Bomb scare delays Mumbai-bound flight at Kolkata airport, passenger detained
content: A passenger on an IndiGo flight from Kolkata to Mumbai triggered a bomb scare at Kolkata airport, leading to heightened security measures. The 26-year-old man made the suspicious comment during a pre-boarding security check, prompting immediate detention and a thorough inspection of the aircraft in an isolation bay.

title: Celtics' Tatum has surgery on ruptured Achilles
content: Boston Celtics forward Jayson Tatum underwent surgery on Tuesday to repair a ruptured right Achilles tendon.

title: Rose, 'Shoeless' Joe HOF-eligible as MLB lifts ban
content: The all-time hit king and Jackson -- both longtime baseball pariahs stained by gambling, seen by MLB as the game's mortal sin -- are now presumably eligible for election into the Baseball Hall of Fame in Cooperstown.

title: Sources: Mavs won't trade No. 1 pick, eye Flagg
content: The Mavericks plan to select Cooper Flagg and will not entertain the possibility of trading away the No. 1 overall draft pick for a proven superstar, sources told ESPN.

title: Belichick has addressed personal life with players
content: North Carolina's Bill Belichick has addressed the attention surrounding girlfriend Jordon Hudson with his team, saying "she doesn't have anything to do with football."

title: Allen estate says Trail Blazers officially for sale
content: Paul Allen's estate announced Tuesday that it has begun the process of selling the Portland Trail Blazers.

title: Cantwell, No. 3 recruit for '26, commits to Canes
content: Offensive tackle Jackson Cantwell, the No. 3 overall prospect in the 2026 ESPN 300 recruiting class, has committed to Miami over Georgia, Oregon and Ohio State.

title: Bengals' Hendrickson: Won't play on current deal
content: Trey Hendrickson said Tuesday that he won't play for the Bengals this season under his current contract in an apparent escalation of his dispute with the team.

title: NHL bans Panthers minority owner for posts on X
content: Florida Panthers minority owner Doug Cifu has been suspended by the NHL for a series of offensive social media posts Sunday night.

title: HC accelerator paused; NFL to reimagine program
content: The NFL has paused the accelerator program it has used for three years to help increase diversity levels in key coaching positions.

title: 🏈 Offseason rankings for Power 4 CFB teams
content: Nail the transfer portal? Miss a big recruit? Find a top coordinator job? All are part of a college team's offseason.

title: 'I wish we had 10 of him': For better, or worse, Russell Westbrook holds the key to the Nuggets' playoff hopes
content: Russell Westbrook is perhaps the NBA's most polarizing player. He has single-handedly won and lost games for the Nuggets. But make no mistake: Denver wouldn't be here without him.

title: Rested, recharged, stronger than ever: How Fever's Caitlin Clark used offseason to reset
content: When cameras weren't catching her hanging with Taylor Swift, Caitlin Clark honed her game on the court and in the weight room.

title: Trends and shocking takeaways from the Stanley Cup playoffs' second round
content: As we approach the elimination games in Round 2, here are the major storylines -- and what comes next.

title: Stanley Cup playoffs daily: What to watch in critical Game 4 of Stars-Jets
content: Will Dallas go up 3-1, or can Winnipeg tie it at 2-2? Game 4 keys, plus highlights, top players from Monday.

title: New NBA mock draft: With Flagg, Harper and Bailey slotted to teams, we project all 59 picks
content: With the Mavericks winning the lottery and the right to draft Cooper Flagg, here's ESPN's updated two-round mock.

title: Biggest questions for all 13 teams in the 2025 NBA lottery
content: Thirteen lottery teams are set for June's NBA draft, and our experts weigh in on the hot topics for each one.

title: Will Marvin Harrison Jr. break out? Can Ladd McConkey be a No. 1? Key questions on 13 second-year NFL WRs
content: We answered big questions about top receivers from the 2024 draft class, including Marvin Harrison Jr., Ladd McConkey and Malik Nabers.

title: 'Ain't nobody like Travis': Why Travis Hunter is ready to be the face of a franchise
content: The Jags plan to play Hunter on both offense and defense, and those who have coached him think he will thrive.

title: Three reasons the Rockies may be the worst MLB team of all time
content: Sorry, Chicago. There's a club in Denver taking being bad to an all new low -- and this is how they're doing it.

title: No school, no field ... and for some, no home: How the Palisades Dolphins rose from the ashes
content: The California wildfires shook their lives. Now, as a chaotic -- but much-needed -- baseball season concludes, the future of their team is in doubt.

title: Storylines: Scottie vs. Rory, LIV contenders and who could surprise
content: Who can compete with McIlroy and Scheffler? Can an under-the-radar player contend? We look at six storylines to watch this week at the PGA Championship.

title: Tier rankings: From Scottie and Rory to just happy to make the cut
content: Can Rory McIlroy win his second major of the year? Which LIV golfers can contend? We break down the field.

title: 10 moves that shaped the WNBA offseason -- and what they mean for 2025
content: Seven head coaching changes. Veterans on the move. Teams rebuilding. Here's a rundown of the key developments.

title: Ranking the top 25 WNBA players
content: How do A'ja Wilson, Napheesa Collier, Breanna Stewart and Caitlin Clark stack up in our preseason rankings?

title: USWNT celebrates 40 years with beautifully complementary kits
content: To celebrate 40 years of the U.S. women's national team, Nike has unveiled kits defined by stars and stripes.

title: Ancelotti on Madrid exit, Brazil deal: 'No drama'
content: Carlo Ancelotti said there's "no need for drama" around his departure from Real Madrid, insisting he remains "totally focused" but admitting the team might need "fresh impetus" after confirming that he'll leave to take charge of Brazil.

title: Sources: Amorim to pay for staff to attend UEL final
content: Amorim has paid for 30 of his Manchester United backroom staff to take their families to next week's Europa League final in Bilbao, Spain

title: USMNT to face Korea, Japan in Sept. friendlies
content: The U.S. men's national team will take on South Korea and Japan in a pair of friendlies in September, the U.S. Soccer Federation announced on Tuesday.

title: Brazil recalls Marta, 39, despite 2024 retirement
content: Brazil's all-time leading scorer Marta has been recalled to the squad for the first time since last year's Olympic final for a pair of friendlies against Japan, coach Arthur Elias announced on Tuesday when naming the 39-year-old.

title: Cristiano Ronaldo's son makes Portugal U15 debut
content: Cristiano Ronaldo's eldest son, Cristiano Ronaldo Júnior, made his debut for Portugal under-15s on Tuesday in a 4-1 win against Japan.

title: Sources: Spurs plan parade for UEL win, Utd won't
content: Tottenham plan to hold a parade if they win the Europa League while opponents Man United have decided against one if they win.

title: Uruguay lose CAS Copa appeal, Núñez ban upheld
content: Liverpool striker Darwin Núñez saw his five-game international ban upheld on Monday after the Court of Arbitration for Sport rejected an appeal from the Uruguay federation over punishments handed out after a brawl at their 2024 Copa América semifinal.

title: Forest slam 'fake news' over owner-manager clash
content: Nottingham Forest have dismissed reports of a heated confrontation between owner Evangelos Marinakis and manager Nuno Espirito Santo as "fake news."

title: Are Liverpool proof coaches don't matter? Or is Slot just better than Klopp?
content: Liverpool were supposed to struggle once Jurgen Klopp left. Instead, Arne Slot won the Premier League. Do coaches just not matter?

title: Stanley Cup playoff odds: Mikko Rantanen second in Conn Smythe odds
content: Every playoff team's odds to win the 2025 Stanley Cup and favorites for the Conn Smythe Trophy for playoff MVP.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Delap to choose Man United over Chelsea
content: Manchester United have moved ahead of Chelsea in the race to sign Liam Delap. Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

title: Flights connecting 6 airports to resume progressively on May 14: IndiGo
content: Air India will progressively resume flights to the airports that have been reopened, according to a source

title: In a first, Maharashtra approves scientific study on serial killers in State prisons
content: The State government has directed prison officers to coordinate with the team of forensic researchers; the study is said to be based on the FBI’s Elite Serial Crime Unit

title: Operation Sindoor: BJP to organise Tiranga rallies in State
content: A massive rally would be organised in Vijayawada on May 15 followed by rallies in all district headquarters the following day

title: Pollachi sexual assault case: scientific investigation, cyber forensics helped in tracing accused and survivors
content: A team of three forensic experts employed morphological comparisons and other techniques to identify the persons in the videos, says CBI Public Prosecutor V. Surendra Mohan

title: Pollachi sexual assault case: Grit of 19-year-old girl exposed a predatory gang of sexual offenders
content: According to the Central Bureau of Intelligence, the accused followed the modus operandi of sexually assaulting the women and filming the act to blackmail them

title: Rajasthan govt. launches drive to fill 1.88 lakh posts
content: A new global capacity centre policy would be brought in the State to create employment opportunities and increase investments in the service sector, Rajasthan Chief Minister says

title: Pakistan High Commission staffer expelled for espionage, linked to case on leak of Army movements
content: According to the Punjab Police, two people were arrested in Malerkotla for passing on troop movements to a Pakistan-based handler

title: Badlapur assault case: Maharashtra issues guidelines for students’ safety in schools
content: The Bombay High Court had ordered the formation of an expert committee to examine and review the safety protocols for children in schools and other educational institutions

title: Goa stampede: Fact finding inquiry committee recommends dissolving the temple management committee
content: The Fact-Finding Inquiry Committee’s report stated that the tragedy was entirely preventable, and stemmed from a combination of poor planning, lack of enforcement, ignored directives, and inadequate infrastructure.

title: Push for mega dams at Arunachal Cabinet on China border
content: A joint venture company was approved for five hydropower projects with a combined capacity of 2,626 megawatts

title: PM Modi calls for targeted interventions in TB elimination efforts
content: PM Modi stresses need to analyse patient trends by occupation and location; reviews progress under National TB Elimination Programme and urges tech-enabled outreach

title: Namma Metro’s Pink Line deadline pushed to 2026
content: The Pink Line connects Kalena Agrahara on Bannerghatta Road with Nagawara on the Outer Ring Road in the northern part of the city

title: Jute Corporation of India increases MSP to stop distress sales
content: JCI officials said that they are using Indian Space Research Organisation technology to upgrade the workings of the industry

title: Amit Shah reviews implementation of three criminal laws in Puducherry, says FIRs should be registered in Tamil
content: The discussion focused on the progress and status of key provisions concerning police, prisons, courts, prosecution, and forensic services.

title: "Acted As A Statesman": Sukhbir Badal Praises PM For Bold Action Against Pak
content: Shiromani Akali Dal supremo Sukhbir Singh Badal on Tuesday lauded Prime Minister Narendra Modi for his strong and clear-headed approach in dealing with the "enemies of peace" across the border.

title: "Persona Non Grata": Pak Asks Indian Diplomat To Leave Country Within 24 Hours
content: Pakistan on Tuesday declared a staff member of the Indian High Commission here "persona non grata" for engaging in activities what it called "incompatible" with his privileged status.

title: "One Day You Will Be Chief Justice, But...": What Justice BR Gavai's Father Had Said
content: Supreme Court's Justice Bhushan Ramakrishna Gavai will take oath as the next Chief Justice of India later today. He steps into the shoes of Justice Sanjiv Khanna, who retired the same day.

title: Former Defence Secretary Ajay Kumar Appointed UPSC Chairman
content: Former defence secretary Ajay Kumar was on Tuesday appointed chairman of the UPSC, according to a Union Personnel Ministry order.

title: As Trump Visits The Middle-East, What The Gulf Arab Nations Want From US
content: The three energy-rich Gulf Arab nations are leveraging their influence over Trump to secure tangible gains, having built personal ties with the president and pledged trillions in US investments.

title: "Woman From Same Community...": Minister's Remarks On Army Officer Spark Row
content: A Madhya Pradesh minister has sparked a political storm with remarks seen as referring to Army Colonel Sofiya Qureshi, one of the officers who led the government briefings on Operation Sindoor.

title: India Pakistan Ceasefire Live Updates | "India Has Just Paused Military Actions": PM Modi Warns Pak
content: India Pakistan Ceasefire LIVE Updates: Operations against Pakistan have only been kept in abeyance and the future will depend on their behaviour, Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Monday said.

title: NIA Arrests 3 Militants Involved In 2 Separate Killings In Manipur
content: The National Investigation Agency (NIA) has arrested two persons belonging to banned militant groups for their involvement in the brutal killing of a woman and burning and looting of houses by armed militants in Manipur's Jiribam district.

title: India Can Hit Every Corner Of Pak, Army, Terrorists Know This Now: PM Modi
content: Standing in front of the advanced S-400 air defence system in Punjab's Adampur, which Pakistan claimed it had destroyed, PM Modi exposed Islamabad's blatant lies when he made a televised address from the forward air force base.

title: BSF Soldier Killed In Action Given Full State Honours In Manipur; "He Was Fearless," Says Top Officer
content: Border Security Force soldier Deepak Chingakham made a huge contribution in destroying a Pakistani post before he received critical injuries from enemy artillery fire, a senior BSF officer told reporters in Manipur's capital Imphal on Tuesday.

title: "Let's Not Trade Nukes, Let's Trade...": Trump On What He Told India, Pak
content: US President Donald Trump, on Tuesday, reiterated the US' role in brokering peace between India and Pakistan, saying he told the two sides to "not trade nuclear missiles (and) trade the things that you make so beautifully".

title: US Announces Fresh Cuts To Harvard, Terminates $450 Million In Grants
content: The US government on Tuesday announced fresh funding cuts to Harvard, a day after the elite school's president said it shared "common ground" with the Trump administration on many issues.

title: Birthright Citizenship Case Arrives At US Supreme Court With Unusual Twist
content: Through an emergency filing, Trump's administration has focused the Supreme Court's attention on whether federal judges should have the power to issue broad orders that block challenged polices on a nationwide, or "universal," basis.

title: All About Sussan Ley, First Woman To Lead Australia's Liberal Party
content: Australia's Liberal Party has elected Sussan Ley as its new leader. She is the first woman ever to helm the party in its 80-year history.

title: 4-Month-Old Baby Attacked By Pet Rottweiler Dog In Gujarat, Dies: Cops
content: A four-month-old baby girl was mauled to death by a pet Rottweiler dog after it broke free from its owner's control at a residential society in Gujarat's Ahmedabad city, police said on Tuesday.

title: Iran "Will Never Have A Nuclear Weapon": Donald Trump
content: US President Donald Trump on Tuesday called Iran the "most destructive force" in the Middle East, blaming Tehran for instability across the region and warning that the United States will never allow it to obtain a nuclear weapon.

title: Punjab Woman Injured During Pakistani Aerial Intrusion Dies
content: A 50-year-old woman who was injured when debris fell on her home during a Pakistani aerial intrusion in Punjab's Ferozepur last week died at a private hospital in Ludhiana on Tuesday, officials said.

title: Son Of BJP Leader Dilip Ghosh's Wife Found Dead
content: The body of the son of BJP leader Dilip Ghosh's wife Rinku Majumdar, from her previous marriage, was found in a flat in New Town area on Tuesday, police said.

title: India's First Manned Deep Ocean Mission To Be Launched By 2026 End
content: India's first manned deep ocean mission 'Samudrayaan' into a 6,000-metre depth using the manned submersible vehicle 'Matsya' is expected to be launched by the end of 2026, National Institute of Ocean Technology (NIOT) Director said.

title: BJP leader Dilip Ghosh’s stepson found dead in Kolkata
content: The preliminary autopsy report of Srinjoy Dasgupta (27) ruled out any foul play and suggested that the death may have resulted in ‘acute haemorrhagic pancreatitis’

title: Pollachi sexual assault case: How nine men operated a notorious racket in a calm, picturesque Pollachi
content: They approached the survivors, mostly hailing from lower socio-economic backgrounds on various pretexts, including offering them jobs

title: India briefs 70 Foreign Service Attaches on Operation Sindoor; China, Turkiye not invited
content: Pakistan Military announces that 11 personnel were killed and 78 others injured during confrontation with India

title: Bihar introduces French and German language courses in 15 engineering colleges
content: Chief Secretary inaugurates foreign language initiative to boost global competence among technical students; plan to expand to all 38 government engineering colleges

title: Fire engulfs Bevco warehouse in Thiruvalla, liquor worth crores of rupees destroyed
content: Seven fire engines were deployed to the site to control the blaze. Despite relentless efforts for over an hour, the fire could not be brought under control and a large section of the facility was reduced to ashes

title: Southwest monsoon advances to the Andaman Sea
content: The monsoon has reached the region over a week earlier as compared to historical data, the IMD has announced, with the expacted onset date over Kerala not yet revealed by the meteorologists.

title: Maharashtra police on alert after anonymous bomb threat email
content: State Disaster Management Control Room receives message warning of possible blast; source under investigation amid heightened India-Pakistan tensions

title: Researchers develop new metal-free organic catalyst which can produce hydrogen fuel by harvesting mechanical energy
content: According to the Department of Science and Technology, in order to reduce global warming and the related impact of fossil fuels, the transition towards sustainable alternatives based on renewable energy becomes increasingly critical

title: Tamil Nadu has given the Armed Forces its all, be it war with China or Pakistan
content: Whenever India is forced into an armed conflict, the State has always stood behind the Centre. Its leaders and people, setting aside their differences, have offered everything, from blood to bullion. Chief Minister M.K. Stalin leading a march last week in solidarity with the Armed Forces, after ‘Operation Sindoor’ was launched, fit in with this tradition

title: SC issues notices to govt. on extended internship, fee charged from medical students who fled war, pandemic
content: ‘The pandemic and/or Russia-Ukraine war had interrupted their education and they have already lost more than one year to complete the course,’ the petition said

title:
When Jayalalithaa government wanted 
Poes Garden declared a ‘no flying zone’
content: The government claimed that around 3 a.m. on May 4, the men on sentry duty had sighted a glider-type aircraft, with no lights, making two or three sorties over her ‘Veda Nilayam’ bungalow. The police had earlier been informed of a likely threat to the Chief Minister from the LTTE, which was banned after Rajiv Gandhi was assassinated

title: All 13 accused in Murshidabad father-son murder are locals, some known to the family
content: Father-son duo Harogobind Das and Chandan Das were killed allegedly in communal violence in Murshidabad’s Samserganj police station area on April 12, following protests against the recently passed Waqf (Amendment) Act, 2025

title: Nagpur court extends Kerala journalist’s police custody
content: Custody had been extended for the ‘purpose of interrogation regarding the seized electronic devices, and for proper investigation of the crime,’ the court said

title: Congress seeks Prime Minister’s clarification over U.S. claims of mediation
content: Congress asks if Modi government will conduct a Kargil Review Committee-type exercise to probe the Pahalgam terror attack.

title: Nitish Kumar pays tribute to BSF sub-inspector Mohammad Imtiaz
content: Chief Minister visits Saran district to meet family; ₹50 lakh ex gratia and government job assured; separate tribute for second martyr Rambabu Singh

title: AP will build port-based economy to harness 1,000-km coastline, says Chandrababu Naidu
content: The Chief Minister said that the State will work towards establishing a port or fishing harbour every 50 kilometres to spur economic growth, employment, and infrastructure development

title: Judiciary has to earn public respect, not try to command it: Chief Justice Khanna
content: CJI Khanna showed firm and principled leadership in addressing instances of judicial misconduct, says Justice Gavai

title: Minister Uttam Reddy hits out at Harish Rao, rebuts allegations on paddy procurement
content: Procurement of paddy as on May 12 is 44% higher compared to same day last year; farmers paid ₹6,671 crore out of ₹9,999 crore so far

title: Tripura inducts 332 women constables in major recruitment drive
content: 332 women among 975 constables recruited in State’s largest single induction drive; Chief Minister links initiative to anti-drug campaign

title: 5th president for Munnar panchayat in four years
content: Congress member M. Manimozhi elected president securing 11 votes, against LDF’s Jyothi Satheesh Kumar who got eight votes

title: Norms for reapportionment of teaching staff in State-run schools announced in A.P.
content: The Director of School Education submitted a proposal on conversion and creations of posts, which the government has approved, according to the proposal some School Assistant posts would be converted as Model Primary School Headmasters/School Assistants

title: Fingerlings of yellow catfish released to Chalakudy river
content: The programme, organised by the Centre for Peninsular Aquatic Genetics Resources (PAGR) of the National Bureau of Fish Genetic Resources (NBFGR), took place near Vettilappara

title: Mysuru: CFTRI can emerge as a launchpad for entrepreneurs, says expert
content: The institute in Mysuru can invest in AI capacity-building, collaborating with tech institutions, bringing in data scientists, and building AI-ready labs, suggests TiE Mysuru chapter president

title: Govt. declares human-wildlife conflict State-specific disaster to expedite relief disbursal
content: Government states that the administration will disburse relief to victims  irrespective of whether the encounters occurred inside protected wildlife reserves or outside the perimeter of such sanctuaries. It also establishes detailed norms for compensating victims of such conflicts and finalised a table for recompense based on the severity of injuries and the extent of financial loss

title: BJP holds memorial meet for Sushil Kumar Modi on first death anniversary
content: Senior BJP and NDA leaders recall the late leader’s legacy in governance and party-building; Nitish Kumar unveils memorial park in his honour

title: People’s campaign to develop Chakkaraparambu-Infopark road gathers momentum
content: Thrikkakara MLA demands allocation of funds to realise the long-overdue eastward extension of the M.G. Road–Pullepady–Thammanam–Chakkaraparambu road towards Infopark through Vennala, Palachuvadu, Kalachal, Thuthiyoor, and Seaport–Airport Road

title: Five drinking water plants opened in Udayagiri constituency
content: With this, the number of water plants inaugurated through the VPR Foundation in SPSR Nellore district touches 170

title: Health Minister expresses ire over graft allegations on govt. medical officers, calls for immediate corrective steps
content: A few District Medical and Health Officers and District Health Services Coordinators need to improve their performance, says Satya Kumar Yadav at a review meet

title: Adikavi Nannaya varsity plans botanical garden to boost green cover on campus

content: the 2025 offseason will be known as the summer of Giannis Antetokounmpo . the 30-year-old is under contract for the next three seasons, with 2027-28 as a player option . he will be eligible to sign a four-year, $293.4 million extension .

title: If Flick can make Barcelona more boring, they'll become unstoppable
content: real madrid beat laliga 3:02 on tuesday night . a total of 25 goals and two trophies were sealed . the UEFA champions league semifinal was a success . it was the final of the laLiga .
